other_tests.findings: Extensive relatively symmetrical white matter hyperintensity involving mostly the subcortical WM. Abnormal signal in the caudate and lentiform nuclei with relative sparing of the thalamus. Increased signal intensity in dentate nuclei. Sparing of the corpus callosum and brainstem.
Massive excretion of 2-hydroxyglutaric acid (>1,000 mmol/mol creatinine).
Homozygous mutation in the L-2-hydroxyglutarate dehydrogenase gene (c.903 T.G) resulting in substitution of tyrosine by a stop codon at position 301 (p.Tyr301X).
